thread.title: Big Agnes Rattlesnake SL3 mtnGLO tent
thread.title_full: Big Agnes Rattlesnake SL3 mtnGLO tent - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Jill K. Robinson
title: Big Agnes Rattlesnake SL3 mtnGLO tent
text:
Photo: Big Agnes print_article_embed|photo-8455478|article-6456649|7 comments_jump_embed|photo-8455478|article-6456649|1 email_share_embed|photo-8455478|article-6456649|1 facebook_share_embed|photo-8455478|article-6456649|2 twitter_share_embed|photo-8455478|article-6456649|3 pinterest_share_embed|photo-8455478|article-6456649|4 reddit_share_embed|photo-8455478|article-6456649|5 google_share_embed|photo-8455478|article-6456649|6 Big Agnes Rattlesnake SL3 mtnGLO Tent Big Agnes Rattlesnake SL3 mtnGLO Tent
Finding the best lightweight tent to take on a backpacking trip often means you have to take out every feature that might make your stay more comfortable in order to avoid killing yourself on the hike. The Big Agnes Rattlesnake SL3 mtnGLO tent weighs 5 pounds, 4 ounces when packed up, making it a reasonable weight to stuff into your backpack. The tent sleeps thee adults (snugly), but two adults and a child have worked fine in my tests. It’s good for three seasons and features a two-door/two-vestibule design, so campers aren’t on top of each other constantly. A Quick Stash area on the tent body door makes stowing the unzipped door simple, so you can focus on enjoying yourself. Big Agnes Rattlesnake SL3 mtnGLO Tent Big Agnes Rattlesnake SL3 mtnGLO Tent
